author: jerenkrantz
msg: - Look for certs dir in logical places if not overriden.
- Have knowledge of platforms with /dev/random and /dev/urandom where
OpenSSL will get the entropy on its own anyway.  If --with-randfile is
not specified, we'll see if it even matters.
- Don't call RAND_load_file if we are relying on /dev/random.

author: jerenkrantz
msg: Yeah, this works now.  And, we'll emit some error that'll help us identify
when someone tries to use SSL when SSL isn't available.
(not a great error message, but still, it's different than what was there.)

author: jerenkrantz
msg: Yo, Aaron, didn't you make some changes?  What were they?  =)

msg: Remove the lameo defaults for randfile and capath.  If SSL is specified,
